Dear to. Hulsen:
Blank you very much for your correspondence regarding
the proposed revisions of the copyright law. I appreciate your
taking the time to set forth so clearly your position on some
of the more difficult questions which a new bill presents.
The Hearings and the many helpful comnents and sugges¬
tions of people like yourself, indicate that there are many
refinements and revisions necessary to achieve a balanced and
workable program. The Subconmittee staff is now in the process
of reviewing a number of proposals and I have brought your
suggestions to their attention.
I intend to follow closely developments on the legisla¬
tion and will certainly keep your point of view in mind as con¬
sideration of the bill progresses.
With best regards, I am
